Because of my natural wake/sleep cycle (which, if left undisturbed would have me going to sleep sometime around 2-3am and waking around 10-11am) and the fact that the world is unfairly biased towards "larks" rather than "owls" - most work hours, all school hours, I've got less than 8 hours sleep a night most of my life. Going to bed at midnight is "an early night" for me - and there's no guarantee I won't just lie awake until 2 or 3 in the morning - and I've got to get up at 7am at the latest in order to get my kids to school and myself to work. This means at best 7 hours of sleep, if not 6, 5 or 4 hours.
Every night from Sunday night/Monday morning to Thursday night/Friday morning.
We need more employers who give "Four to Midnight" as options for work hours and we need schools that have hours more conducive to those kids that are naturally "night owls" or are children of "night owls" - the way the whole world has been co-opted by those bloody morning people is frankly a disgrace.
For tens of thousands of years, we "night owls" protected those lily-livered soft "early to bed, early to rise" larks while they slept; kept them safe from night-hunting predators and invasions from other tribes. Now, the "larks" control the world and call us "lazy" because we don't spring joyously out of bed at the first dim light of dawn - that's their "gratitude" for ya! Because of their narcissistic pseudo-pious attitude towards "the right time to rise" and "the right time to sleep", we night owls have to work to the larks' time schedule.
Time to balance the books, I think: it's time we make the "standard work hours" 4pm to midnight and call them "lazy" when they start nodding off at 8 or 9pm...

Now for the details.
2 days ago i crashed my car due to falling asleep at the wheel. It was surreal, i still feel like it didn’t happen, I remember driving normally tried thinking about going to work and getting a coffee, then a wave of comfort washing over me, my eyes starting to close and my vision turning white. I felt a bump as my car hit a person in the other lane, my tire got bent outwards and i swerved into a ditch. 6-7k to fix there’s(lucky i have insurance on that), and my car(2002 Subaru Impreza) is probably totaled. I had no insurance on my car. For weeks i had been getting 7-6 or even 5 hours of sleep due to school, my job, and going out with friends. I had no idea a consecutive shortage in sleep could lead your brain just saying “Screw it, it’s nap time” in the middle of driving. Don’t repeat my mistake, I’m gonna be sure to get my beauty sleep now.

By the way did you know air bags cost 1-1.5k to replace, and i popped two of the other drivers. Also court fees cost a good bit, a $25 ticket for crossing the median and almost $200 for fees - and i payed it online too. Im very lucky i was going just 20mphish, and I’m 17 so at least i have ample time to pay this off. I feel terrible though, my parents insurance is up, my car is probably gone, and i scared the crap outta an old lady. Goodbye savings. Life goes on though, and ill be fine in time, could’ve been much worse and ill be sure to learn from my mistake.
